answers.answer: There are a few possible causes for heavy water consumption and heavy urination, kidney issues being one of them. Diabetes being another...but there are other causes.I would definitely take her to be thoroughly checked out. Get her blood tested as well -just to be on the safe side. It won't do any harm. And if all is normal, then that will put your mind at rest.Dogs who eat solely dry food will have a greater thirst, of course. Also young dogs who do a lot of playing and racing about will get thirsty.Once you know her health is OK, then get down to the behaviour-training.I am sure other people here will help out as I haven't much experience with potty-training a young pup! Forgive me!

question: 6 mos old, 50 lb female pees dozens of time a day in and out.  Large volume, is always thirsty.  Does not pee in her crate at night.  Does her food not have enough moisture?  I feed her a salmon based dry food.  Although pees outside, prefers to pee in the house in big puddles.  Punishment has not worked.  Will run in the park for 20 minutes, come home and pee there upon arrival.  How did i reverse train?  Kidney issue maybe?  Just sent a urine sample in.
title: Malamute Puppy Urination
